content: The Act titled "Women's Health Research and Prevention Amendments of 1998" amends the Public Health Service Act to include research on drug DES and a national program for education of health professionals and the public. The Act "Women's Health Research and Prevention Amendments of 1998" amends the Public Health Service Act to include a national program for educating health professionals and the public about the drug diethylstilbestrol (DES). The Secretary will work with agencies to implement the program, consulting with nonprofit entities and starting in fiscal year 1999. Authorization of appropriations is provided for this purpose. In addition to existing appropriations, funds are authorized for fiscal years 1999 through 2003 for research on osteoporosis, Paget's disease, and related bone disorders.
